intro: Loeseneriella apocynoides var. guineensis, commonly known as the Guinean milkweed, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. The plant is known for its milky sap, which is characteristic of the Apocynaceae family.
